div.p: Louis Koch (1862-1932), antiquarian music dealer in Frankfurt, specialising in scores and letters. According to OJ 10/3, [3], Koch took over the autograph manuscripts previously owned by Carl Meinert in 1913.

Schenker had dealings with him over the autograph manuscript of the Beethoven Piano Sonata in A major, Op. 101 in the period following 1912. Koch also included in his vast collection the autograph of Beethoven's Diabelli Variations, and works by Haydn, Mozart, and Schubert.
Bibliography: G. Kinsky and M.A. Souchay, eds.: Manuskripte, Briefe, Dokumente von Scarlatti bis Stravinsky: Katalog der Musikautographen-Sammlung Louis Koch (Stuttgart, 1953)
